tourName: Wonders of Japan: Whirlwind Cultural Encounter Tour
placesVisited: Kanazawa, Shirakawa-go, Takayama, Koyasan, Kyoto, Tokyo, Osaka
generalInfo: From the dazzling neon-lit, skyscraping cityscape of Tokyo to the deeply-rooted cultural highlights peppering the forests of Kyoto, explore the best that Japan has to offer on this tailored 9-day tour. Along the way, scenes of the sprawling unspoiled countryside and tastes of world-famous Japanese delicacies will be yours to enjoy as you spend time in a country rich with heritage.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo - The Future of Japan
dayInfo.description: Approaching Japan, you will catch a glimpse of Tokyo’s soaring skyline from your airplane window. Light from above the clouds will flood the landscape, dancing off of the city’s palatial skyscrapers and shimmering off of their neon-lit facades. This modern metropolitan is both a vision of the future and a window into the past, showcasing sophisticated technological advancements and traditional heritage sites across its eclectic districts. You will meet your private transfer at the airport and venture into the heart of Tokyo, where you will spend an evening adjusting to its exuberant energy.

dayInfo.title: Kanazawa - Fragrant Flower Fields and Colorful Geisha Districts
dayInfo.description: After a day in the beating heart of Japan, Tokyo, you will be thrilled to zip across the countryside to the illustrious rolling hills of Kanazawa. Chaperoned by a private driver and tour guide, you will be whisked away to the landscaped gardens and elaborate geisha districts peppering the destination. Between flower fields stretching as far as the eye can see and colorful fashion statements donned by the modern-day geishas, you will begin your discoveries of Japan’s immaculate environments and deep-rooted culture during your stay in Kanazawa.

dayInfo.title: Shirakawa-go - A Vision of the Past
dayInfo.description: The further you travel into the Japanese countryside, the closer the locals’ connection to their cultural roots are. In Shirakawa-go, traditional thatched houses reminiscent of the early Japanese eras still stand as dwellings for the Gifu prefecture residents. Underneath the mighty mountain horizon, you will find peace and quiet away from the crowds before you venture to Takayama for a day, exploring the meticulous craftsmanship of Japan’s oldest carpenters as well as the relics retained in historic sites throughout the age-old town.

dayInfo.title: Osaka - Extravagance in the Precious Port City
dayInfo.description: Neighboring the Japanese seas, Osaka is a thriving port side city that forms one of the country’s most vibrant destinations. Composed of exalted eateries, decadent bars, elaborate theatres, and momentous sports grounds, to name a few, Osaka is a dazzling display of Japan’s rich tapestry of entertainment-centered experiences. While in Osaka, you will tour with a knowledgeable guide who will show you some of the finest food markets and cultural landmarks, including Doguyasuji, Dotonbori, and Tsutenkaku. Each offers a glimpse into the extravagance of Osaka; you will be blown away as you move through the cityscape.

dayInfo.title: Koyasan - Timeless Spiritual Temple of Japan
dayInfo.description: The fifth day of your tour is dedicated to enriching your vacation as you travel to the temple town of Koyasan for immersion in Japan’s sanctified spiritual traditions. Stationed on the crest of a rising mountain and flanked by ancient cedar trees, the Koyasan temple complex is both a pivotal part of Japanese spiritual history and a marvel to behold. From the remarkable Okunoin Cemetery to the iconic architectural constructions, you will twist and turn in all directions as you uncover the historic landmarks sweeping the cherished complex.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto - Welcome to the Imperial Capital
dayInfo.description: Following breakfast, you will begin your adventure to Kyoto, where you will spend two nights in the former imperial city of Japan and age-old capital of a bygone era. Kyoto is drenched in heritage that you will come to discover the longer you spend wandering its charming traditional districts to significant historic landmarks. From a golden temple circled by a tranquil lake to an endless shrine weaving through the forest like a snake, you will be absorbed by the sheer beauty of the landmarks that lay speckled across Kyoto’s forested regions.

dayInfo.title: Kyoto - Tea Ceremonies and Terrific Tours
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will relish the opportunity to participate in a traditional Japanese tea ceremony led by a master tea artist. Peaceful and shrouded in the fragrances of the aromatic brews, the atmosphere is one of a kind, and you will be entranced by the carefully considered process undergone by the tea artist. Following the spiritual experience, you will set off on a tour of Kyoto to its many marvelous heritage sites and decorated neighborhoods. From the Kimono Museum's colorful exhibits to the mouthwatering delicacies presented at the Nishiki Market, enjoy an authentic taste of Kyoto.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo - Robots from the Future
dayInfo.description: During your brief day in Tokyo at the beginning of your vacation, you will have familiarized yourself with the future-focused ambiance of the city. Today, after transferring here and checking into your accommodation, you will explore this futurism like never before during a Robot Show. Showing off the visionary works of Japan’s leading scientists in the most colorful and flamboyant way, the show is an example of the kind of modernity sweeping the buzzing capital of Japan. This sensory night will dazzle and delight you before you enjoy a sumptuous supper and return to your room.

dayInfo.title: Tokyo - Last Chance to See Tokyo
dayInfo.description: Today, being your last chance to see the wondrous city of Tokyo, you will rise early as the rest of the city kicks into gear. From your window, you will see crowds flood the streets as locals and foreigners search for something savory to sink their teeth into. You may enjoy a light exploration of the neighborhood after breakfast, finding a few hidden gems in the back alleys you wander along and snapping up more pictures to commemorate your enchanting stay in Japan. After the brief excursion, you will be collected by your private transfer and taken to the airport.
